vague_description: Determining the optimal number of different factory types to construct within operator constraints to meet toy production goals.
detailed_description: A toy company can build two factory types, a medium-sized factory and a small factory. A medium-sized factory can make \param{ToysMedium} toys per day and requires \param{OperatorsMedium} operators. A small factory can make \param{ToysSmall} toys per day and requires \param{OperatorsSmall} operators. The company must make at least \param{ToysMin} toys per day but they only have \param{OperatorsTotal} operators available. How many of each factory should the company build to minimize the total number of factories?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of factories built
target_constraints: Number of medium-sized factories is non-negative
Number of small factories is non-negative
Company must produce at least ToysMin toys per day
Company has only OperatorsTotal operators available
target_parameters: Number of toys produced per day by a medium-sized factory
Number of operators required for a medium-sized factory
Number of toys produced per day by a small factory
Number of operators required for a small factory
Minimum number of toys to be produced per day
